<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	FIGURE 4
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/03/0001558370-16-003821_VSTM20151231X10K004.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 6.125IN; HEIGHT: 3.25IN" ALT="PICTURE 15">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/03/0001558370-16-003821_VSTM20151231X10K005.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 5.108333IN; HEIGHT: 2.875IN" ALT="PICTURE 23">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;6063
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063, or defactinib, is an orally
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;available small molecule
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	kinase inhibitor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	designed to inhibit FAK signaling. We are currently evaluating VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 as a potential therapy for pancreatic cancer, ovarian cancer, NSCLC, and other solid tumors.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	linical trials of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 in patients with cancer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	currently
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	includ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a Phase 1 study in combination with Merck&#x2019;s PD-1 inhibitor pembrolizumab and gemcitabine in patients with pancreatic cancer, a Phase&nbsp;1/1b clinical trial of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 in combination with paclitaxel for patients with ovarian cancer, a Phase&nbsp;2 study of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 in patients with NSCLC, a Phase&nbsp;2 trial preceding surgery in mesothelioma
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, a combination trial of VS-6063 and VS-5584 in patients with relapsed mesothelioma, and a Phase 1/1b&nbsp;&nbsp;clinical collaboration with Pfizer and Merck KGaA to evaluate VS-6063 in combination with avelumab in patients with ovarian cancer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. We have received
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	13
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage14"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	orphan drug designation for VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 in ovarian cancer and mesothelioma in the United States
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the European Union
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, and Australia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Development status of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	&#8209;6063
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Phase 1 study in combination with immunotherapy in pancreatic cancer.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 is in a dose escalation study in combination with Merck&#x2019;s PD-1 inhibitor pembrolizumab and gemcitabine in patients with advanced pancreatic cancer. This Phase 1 clinical trial is anticipated to enroll approximately 50 patients and is being conducted at the Washington University School of Medicine&#x2019;s Division of Oncology under the direction of Andrea Wang-Gillam, M.D., Ph.D., Clinical Director of the Gastrointestinal Oncology Program. This trial is primarily designed to evaluate the safety of the combination regimen and may also provide a greater understanding of how FAK inhibition in combination with immunotherapies could improve outcomes for patients with pancreatic cancer. We expect a data readout from this trial to occur in 2017.&nbsp;&nbsp;This is the first of several combination clinical trials
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we expect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	will be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	initiate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	during 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This clinical study is supported by a growing body of preclinical research suggesting that FAK inhibition, when combined with PD-1 inhibitors, increases the anti-tumor activity of these immunotherapeutic agents. As published in the journal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cell
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(24 Sept 2015), FAK inhibition has been shown to increase cytotoxic (CD8+) T cells in tumors, decrease T cell exhaustion, decrease immunosuppressive cell populations, enhance T cell killing of tumor cells, and create a generally more favorable tumor microenvironment, which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	should
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	allow for enhanced efficacy of immuno-oncology therapeutics.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Pancreatic cancer, along with other tumors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	such as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	glioblastoma and prostate cancer, are tumor types in which immunotherapeutics have achieved limited clinical benefit, possibly due to the dense desmoplastic stroma and the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	abundance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of immunosuppressive cells. Preclinical research has demonstrated that high stromal density prevents anti-cancer agents and T cells from entering pancreatic tumors thereby limiting efficacy. In preclinical research conducted by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	us
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and others, FAK inhibition was shown to reduce stromal density and allow cytotoxic T cells to better penetrate the tumor and kill the cancer cells. Collectively, these data provide strong rationale for combining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	FAK inhibitors with checkpoint inhibitors in the clinic for pancreatic cancer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Phase 1/1b
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	study with Pfizer and Merck KGaA in combination with immunotherapy in ovarian cancer.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	March
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2016, we announced a new clinical collaboration with Pfizer and Merck KGaA to evaluate VS-6063 in combination with avelumab in patients with ovarian cancer.&nbsp;&nbsp;Avelumab is a human programmed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	death
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ligand 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	PD-L1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, blocking antibody that binds to the PD-L1 ligand expressed on tumor cells. Preclinical research has suggested that the combination of these two agents holds potential to improve the clinical response in patients with cancer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Phase&nbsp;1/1b clinical trial of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;6063 in combination with paclitaxel in patients with ovarian cancers.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Ovarian cancer rapidly develops resistance to chemotherapy. Following development of resistance to front
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;line platinum therapy, there is not an approved standard of care although treatment with the chemotherapeutic paclitaxel is often used. A clinical trial to evaluate the safety and efficacy of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 administered in combination with paclitaxel in patients with advanced ovarian cancer has demonstrated that the combination is generally well tolerated and the&nbsp;&nbsp;study is currently in long term follow up.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This clinical study is comprised of two parts. Part&nbsp;1 is a dose-escalation of oral VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 twice daily in addition to the standard dose of weekly paclitaxel. The purpose of part&nbsp;1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to assess the safety, evaluate pharmacokinetic parameters and determine the recommended Phase&nbsp;2 dose in combination with paclitaxel. Part&nbsp;2 includes patients treated with the recommended Phase 2 dose of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 in combination with paclitaxel. The purpose of part&nbsp;2 is to evaluate the pharmacodynamic effect, the biochemical and physiological effect of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 through measurement of biomarkers from tumor biopsies pre
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209; and post
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;treatment and assess the anti
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;cancer activity of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 when administered in combination with paclitaxel according to RECIST guidelines.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We believe this approach will allow us to treat both the non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;CSCs and CSCs simultaneously by the combination of chemotherapy (e.g., paclitaxel) and a CSC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;targeted agent (VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063) to hopefully enable a more durable clinical response.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	14
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage15"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The addition of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, at either the 200mg/BID or 400mg/BID dose level,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the standard dose of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	weekly paclitaxel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, which is 80mg/m
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was generally well tolerated with no worsening of the well
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;known side effects of paclitaxel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	400mg/BID is the recommended Phase&nbsp;2 dose of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 both as a single agent and in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	combination with weekly paclitaxel. As of February 23, 2015, 20 serious adverse events
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	SAEs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, were observed in 10 patients (45.5%). All but one SAE (Grade 3 dehydration, deemed possibly related) were deemed to be not related or unlikely.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of February 23, 2015, this study has demonstrated that VS-6063 can be safely combined with paclitaxel in ovarian cancer.&nbsp;&nbsp;41% of patients have achieved a best overall response of at least stable disease of greater than or equal to 6 months as per RECIST guidelines in this ongoing study. Biomarker data on biopsies obtained pre
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209; and post
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;treatment with VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 (400mg BID) as a single agent for 10&nbsp;days shows reductions in FAK activity and decreases in cancer stem cells. In addition, of the twenty
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;two patients treated with the combination of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 and paclitaxel, three partial responses and two complete responses have been reported as of and four patients remain on study as of December&nbsp;21, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	FIGURE 5
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/03/0001558370-16-003821_VSTM20151231X10K006.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 5.7IN; HEIGHT: 3.275IN" ALT="PICTURE 17">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Phase&nbsp;2 study of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;6063 in patients w
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ith
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	NSCLC.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;We are conducting a multi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;center study of single-agent VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 in patients with recurrent NSCLC following previous chemotherapy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Phase&nbsp;2 study is designed to assess the effect of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 on progression free survival, overall response rate, and overall survival. Fifty-three patients were enrolled at 9&nbsp;sites in the US. Forty-seven patients were evaluable. The median number of prior lines of therapy was 3 (range 1-8).&nbsp;&nbsp;The result
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of this clinical trial, which were reported at the 2015 World Conference on Lung Cancer, demonstrated that 16 of 44 evaluable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	patients (36%) met the 12 week progression free survival (P
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	FS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	endpoint, with one patient achieving a parti
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	al response. Median PFS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was 11.7 weeks with 6 patients on study for greater than 6 months. Single-agent VS-6063 was generally well tolerated and demonstrated promising clinical activity in patients with refractory, advanced KRAS-mutated NSCLC. Adverse events considered at least possibly related to defactinib were experienced by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	41
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	patients (7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	%) and the majority of these were grade 1 or 2.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Thirteen
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	patients (24%) experienced at least possibly related grade 3-5 events. Underlying disease was a co
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	nfounding factor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The most commonly reported treatment emergent adverse events of any grade were fatigue (2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	%) and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	nausea
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	36
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	%).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	15
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage16"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	FIGURE 6
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/03/0001558370-16-003821_VSTM20151231X10K007.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 5.658333IN; HEIGHT: 2.841667IN" ALT="PICTURE 18">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Single-agent VS-6063 achieved comparable activity to docetaxel and other investigational monotherapies, despite greater median prior lines of therapy.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	One patient remains on study as of December 21, 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	These data support further development of VS-6063, particularly in combination with an immunotherapy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Phase&nbsp;2 trial preceding surgery in mesothelioma (Window of Opportunity).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 is currently in an open
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;label neoadjuvant study in subjects with malignant pleural mesothelioma who are eligible for surgery. Neoadjuvant refers to the administration of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 prior to surgery to remove the mesothelioma tumor. The purpose of this study is to assess biomarker responses from tumor tissue.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Patients are administered VS-6063 for 12 to 35 days.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The safety, pharmacokinetics, and tumor response rate to VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 are also being assessed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In October 2014, results from part one were presented at the International Mesothelioma Interest Group
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	iMig
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	meeting. Based upon biopsy results, treatment with VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 for 12&nbsp;days reduced FAK activity by an average of 70% in evaluable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	post-treatment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	biopsies and decreases in a marker of cancer stem cells were observed in five of seven evaluable biopsies. In addition, the results of the pre
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209; and post
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;treatment PET/CT scans, as measured by RECIST modified for mesothelioma, indicated that no disease progression was observed and that reductions in tumor size consistent with a partial response were observed in two patients. A waterfall plot of the tumor size measurements is presented in Figure&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	VS-6063 was well tolerated with no apparent negative impact on surgical outcome.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Part two of the study, where the treatment period
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is increased from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	12 to 35&nbsp;days, is currently ongoing.&nbsp;&nbsp;We expect to report preliminary data on this extended treatment cohort in the first half of 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage17"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	FIGURE 7
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/03/0001558370-16-003821_VSTM20151231X10K008.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 5.14IN; HEIGHT: 2.53IN" ALT="PICTURE 19">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Phase&nbsp;1 clinical trial in advanced solid tumors.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 demonstrated a good safety profile and initial signs of clinical activity in a Phase&nbsp;1 trial in 46 patients with advanced solid tumors. Patients were selected on the basis of a confirmed diagnosis of a non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;hematologic malignancy that was unresponsive to currently available therapies or for which no standard therapy existed. VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 was administered on a twice daily (BID) schedule and dose cohorts initially included a minimum of 3&nbsp;patients. Dosing was based on flat milligram increments without adjustment for body size, the starting dose being 12.5 mg BID in the initial cohort. Safety, activity and pharmacokinetics, the process by which a drug is absorbed, distributed and metabolized in the body, were measured. 16 of the 37&nbsp;subjects enrolled, or 43%, at doses greater than or equal to 100 mg BID (predicted active dose) experienced stable disease as their best response to treatment. Based on safety, pharmacokinetics, and activity of VS-6063 in the Phase 1 trial, the recommended Phase 2 dose was determined to be 400 mg/BID.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	FIGURE 8
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/03/0001558370-16-003821_VSTM20151231X10K009.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 5.666667IN; HEIGHT: 3.383333IN" ALT="PICTURE 20">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Phase&nbsp;1 study of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;6063 in Japanese patients.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;In November 2014, we reported data from a Phase&nbsp;1 dose escalation study of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 as a single agent in Japanese patients. The study results showed that VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	17
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage18"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	generally well tolerated and side effects were consistent with previously reported results from our U.S. Phase&nbsp;1 trial in non-Japanese patients
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The dose levels were 200, 400 or 600mg of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 BID. No dose limiting toxicities or SAEs were observed at any dose cohort. All treatment emergent adverse events were generally mild or moderate in nature, or grade 1 or 2 as determined in accordance with commonly accepted terminology for adverse events, except for one subject in the 200mg BID cohort who exhibited a Grade 3 increase in serum bilirubin, defined as between 3 and 10 times the value of the upper limit of the normal laboratory range. No associated increase in aspartate transaminase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	AST
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or alanine transaminase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ALT
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were observed in this subject.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Phase 2 study in mesothelioma (COMMAND).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;On September 28, 2015, we stopped enrollment in our Phase 2 randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study (COMMAND) evaluating single-agent VS-6063&nbsp;&nbsp;as switch maintenance in patients with mesothelioma who had achieved disease stability after at least 4 cycles of chemotherapy. The decision to stop enrollment for futility followed a Data Safety Monitoring Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(DSMB)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	review of a pre-planned interim analysis. The results of the analysis demonstrated that VS-6063 had a generally well tolerated safety profile but that there was not a sufficient level of efficacy to warrant continuation of the study.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;4718
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718 is an orally
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;available small molecule compound designed to inhibit FAK signaling. We are evaluating VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718 as a potential therapy for multiple solid tumors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Development status of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	&#8209;4718
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are conducting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	both
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Phase 1, single-agent, dose escalation trial of VS-4718 in patients with advanced cancers and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Phase&nbsp;1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	dose-escalation clinical trial evaluating 28-day cycles of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718 in combination with gemcitabine (a chemotherapy) and nab-paclitaxel (Abraxane&#xAE;; a chemotherapy) in patients with advanced solid tumors. We are planning to initiate an expansion cohort during 2016 evaluating the recommended Phase 2 dose in combination with gemcitabine/nab-paclitaxel chemotherapy in first line pancreatic cancer.&nbsp;&nbsp;A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s of December 21, 2015, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Maximum Tolerated Dose
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	MTD
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	had not been reached
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in either trial.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Preclinical development
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are conducting a comprehensive program to study VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718 as a potential treatment for cancers. Key results to date from preclinical studies of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718 are summarized below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Biochemical and cellular tests.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;In biochemical testing, VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718 inhibited purified FAK and demonstrated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	in vitro
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	selectivity against a panel of 107 different protein kinases. In addition, in various
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	in vitro
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	assessments of drug effects on CSCs, VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718 exhibited potent activity and a preferential effect, or selectivity, for CSCs as compared to other types of cancer cells.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	FAK inhibitors produce favorable changes to immune system and decrease tumor burden.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;In September 2015, researchers from the University of Edinburgh published a study in the journal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cell
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	that highlights the potential of FAK inhibition to enable the body&#x2019;s immune system to fight cancer. The paper discussed results from preclinical research showing that FAK enables cancer cells to evade attack by the immune system. In this study, the researchers discovered that FAK inhibition can modulate the balance of immune cells in the tumor enabling an immune response to destroy the cancer cells. The research, which was carried out in mice with squamous cell carcinoma, showed complete T-cell mediated tumor regression when the mice were administered the FAK inhibitor VS-4718. This research is the first to demonstrate that FAK inhibition increases the presence of cytotoxic T cells in the tumor and decreases the presence of immunosuppressive T regulatory cells.&nbsp;&nbsp;This groundbreaking research showed that FAK inhibition can induce tumor regression through a T cell-mediated mechanism and su
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	pport the approach that we are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	pursuing by combining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	FAK inhibitors with immuno-oncology agents with the goal of yielding more durable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	18
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage19"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	responses for patients with cancer.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	presented this data at the 2015 NCI/AACR/EORTC and SITC scientific conferences.&nbsp;&nbsp;See figure
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	FAK inhibition reduces stromal density, enabling therapies and immune cells to penetrate tumors.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In October 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	presented preclinical data (DeNardo, et al) demonstrating that FAK inhibition reduces stromal density and increases T cell entry in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to the tumor.&nbsp;&nbsp;In this study, our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	FAK inhibitor combined with immunotherapeutic agent inhibiting PD-1/PD-L1 signaling improved long term survival in an aggressive pancreatic cancer model. These data support the clinical evaluation of FAK inhibitors in combination with a PD-1 or PD-L1 antibody in patients with pancreatic an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	d other cancers. We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	presented this data at the 2015 NCI/AACR/EORTC and SITC scientific conferences. See figure
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	PI3K/mTOR Inhibition Program
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The PI
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	kinase/mTOR pathway plays a central role in cancer cell proliferation and survival. Depending on the mode of pathway activation, different PI3K isoforms and mTOR complexes have been shown to play essential roles in oncogenesis and survival of CSCs. There are four Class&nbsp;1 PI3K enzymes, known as alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, and two mTOR complexes known as mTORC1 and mTORC2.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Studies published in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Nature
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2006 reported that genetic activation of the PI3K/mTOR pathway in adult blood cells led to generation of leukemia CSCs. In addition, multiple studies have shown that PI3K pathway activity contributes to the maintenance of CSCs in breast, lung, and prostate cancers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;5584
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5584 is an orally available small molecule that potently and selectively inhibits both PI3K and mTORC1/2 signaling. A 2013 study published in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Science Translational Medicine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	described findings that the observed resistance to PI3K
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209; alpha inhibitors in breast cancer is mediated by signaling through the mTOR complex. We believe that the dual inhibition of mTORC1/2 and PI3K by VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5584 may provide a greater clinical benefit for patients.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Development status of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	&#8209;5584
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are conducting a Phase&nbsp;1, dose-escalation clinical trial of our dual PI3K/mTORC1/2 inhibitor, VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5584, in patients with advanced non-hematologic m
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	alignancies or lymphoma.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The dose range of 5-75mg TIW has been evaluated and reductions in pharmacodynamic markers of PI3K and mTOR activity have been observed at many of the higher dose levels. Preliminary signs of clinical activity have been observed and disease control of at least six months has been observed in some patients.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	A cohort of this trial is enrolling additional patients to confirm the recommended dose for a Phase 2 trial. We are planning to initiate two expansion cohorts during 2016 to evaluate the recommended Phase 2 dose in ovarian
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	/endometrial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	cancer and non-hodgkins lymphoma
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	NHL
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	) or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	chronic lymphocytic leukemia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	CLL
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	A Phase&nbsp;1 clinical trial of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5584 in combination with VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 for patients with relapsed mesothelioma where the anticipated recommended VS-5584 Phase 2 dose of 55mg was combin
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	with the 400mg BID of VS-6063
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is ongoing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Preclinical development
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are conducting a comprehensive preclinical program to study VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5584 as a potential treatment for cancer. Detailed results from this development were published in the January 2015 edition of the journal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cancer Research
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Key results of this program to date are summarized below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	19
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage20"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Biochemical testing.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;In biochemical testing, VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5584 was equipotent against all four human Class&nbsp;1 PI3K isoforms and mTOR kinase, the enzymatic component of both mTORC1 and mTORC2 (IC
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	50
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	values displayed below in nM). In general, the more potent a drug is, the lower the dose required for a therapeutic effect. An IC
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	50
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	value measures the dose at which the activity of the enzyme is reduced by 50%, a commonly used measure of potency. VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5584 has demonstrated a selective effect for these kinases versus a panel of over 400 kinases.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	FIGURE 9
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/03/0001558370-16-003821_VSTM20151231X10K010.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 3.383333IN; HEIGHT: 0.9416667IN" ALT="PICTURE 21">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	In vitro killing of CSCs.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;In an in vitro test, SUM159 triple negative breast cancer cells were treated with VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5584 or paclitaxel for 4&nbsp;days, and the percentage of Aldefluor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;positive CSCs was assessed. VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;5584 dose
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dependently decreased the percentage of CSCs, while paclitaxel increased the percentage of CSCs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Key results from the 2015 Cancer Research Article.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The study results demonstrated that VS-5584 is up to 30-fold more potent in inhibiting the proliferation and survival of CSCs compared to non-CSCs in solid tumor cell populations.&nbsp;&nbsp;VS-5584 preferentially diminished CSC levels in multiple mouse xenograft models of human cancer.&nbsp;&nbsp;Similarly, VS-5584 treatment ex vivo preferentially reduced CSCs in surgically resected breast and ovarian patient tumors.&nbsp;&nbsp;In contrast, chemotherapeutics such as paclitaxel, cisplatin, and etoposide effectively targeted bulk tumor cells, but enriched CSCs.&nbsp;&nbsp;Mechanistic investigations revealed that knock down of PI3K&#x3B1;, PI3K&#x3B2; or mTOR alone was insufficient to decrease CSCs, while knock down of PI3K&#x3B1;, PI3K&#x3B2; and mTOR together effectively reduced CSCs mimicking the effect of VS-5584.&nbsp;&nbsp;Consistent with CSC ablation, VS-5584 delayed tumor regrowth following chemotherapy in mouse xenograft models of small cell lung cancer.&nbsp;&nbsp;These data help to elucidate the mechanism of VS-5584 targeting CSCs and provide a strong rationale for the clinical development of VS-5584 in combination with chemotherapeutic agents targeting bulk tumor cells to achieve more durable clinical responses in cancer patients.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	FIGURE 10
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/03/0001558370-16-003821_VSTM20151231X10K011.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 6.358333IN; HEIGHT: 3.341667IN" ALT="PICTURE 22">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	OUR MANAGEMENT TEAM AND SCIENTIFIC CO
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;FOUNDERS AND ADVISORS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our experienced management team includes our President and Chief Executive Officer, Robert Forrester, our Chief Financial Officer, John &#x201C;Jack&#x201D; Green, C.P.A, and our Chief Operating Officer, Daniel Paterson.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Forrester has been the chief executive officer, chief operating officer and chief financial officer of both private and public life science companies, including Forma Therapeutics,&nbsp;Inc., CombinatoRx,&nbsp;Inc. and Coley Pharmaceutical Group,&nbsp;Inc., which was acquired by Pfizer&nbsp;Inc. in 2007.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Paterson has over 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;years of experience in management roles at healthcare and biotechnology companies, including as chief executive officer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	chief operating officer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and chief business officer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, and specific expertise in oncology drug and diagnostic product development
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, business development, and launch planning
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Mr.&nbsp;Paterson was Head of Global Strategy for Specialty Market and Patient
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Level Data at IMS Health after playing a key role in the acquisition of PharMetrics by IMS Health as VP, Marketing and Corporate Development.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Mr.&nbsp;Green serves in a part-time capacity at Verastem
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Prior to Verastem, he was the Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of GTC Biotherapeutics (formerly Genzyme Transgenics Corporation), which was spun out from Genzyme Corporation as a stand
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;alone public company and then the Vice President, Finance, of On-Q-ity. Mr.&nbsp;Green is a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) with over 30&nbsp;years of financial experience, including 20 within the biotechnology industry.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our scientific co
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;founders are recognized leaders in the field of cancer biology. Robert Weinberg, Ph.D., Founding Member of the Whitehead Institute and Professor of Biology at MIT, has played a key role in identifying the genetic basis of cancer. Dr.&nbsp;Weinberg discovered the first tumor oncogene, the first tumor suppressor gene, the role of a protein related to the cell surface receptor HER2 in preclinical studies and the mechanisms underlying the formation of CSCs. Eric Lander, Ph.D., Founding Director of the Broad Institute, Professor of Biology at MIT and Professor of Systems Biology at Harvard Medical School, played a central role in the Human Genome Project. Collaborative research in the labs of Dr.&nbsp;Lander and Dr.&nbsp;Weinberg developed our proprietary technology for use in the identification of drugs targeting CSCs and a genetic expression signature, useful as a biomarker, to monitor the effect of treatment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We strive to protect the proprietary technology that we believe is important to our business, including seeking and maintaining patents intended to cover our product candidates and compositions, their methods of use and processes for their manufacture, and any other aspects of inventions that are commercially important to the development of our business. We also rely on trade secrets to protect aspects of our business that are not amenable to, or that we do not consider appropriate for, patent protection.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We plan to continue to expand our intellectual property estate by filing patent applications directed to compositions, methods of treatment and patient selection created or identified from our ongoing development of our product candidates. Our success will depend on our ability to obtain and maintain patent and other proprietary protection for commercially important technology, inventions and know
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;how related to our business, defend and enforce our patents, preserve the confidentiality of our trade secrets and operate without infringing the valid and enforceable patents and proprietary rights of third parties. We also rely on know
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;how, continuing technological innovation and in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;licensing opportunities to develop and maintain our proprietary position. We seek to obtain domestic and international patent protection, and endeavor to promptly file patent applications for new commercially valuable inventions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The patent positions of biopharmaceutical companies like us are generally uncertain and involve complex legal, scientific and factual questions. In addition, the coverage claimed in a patent application can be significantly reduced before the patent is issued, and patent scope can be reinterpreted by the courts after issuance. Moreover, many jurisdictions permit third parties to challenge issued patents in administrative proceedings, which may result in further narrowing or even cancellation of patent claims. We cannot predict whether the patent applications we are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	21
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	currently pursuing will issue as patents in any particular jurisdiction or whether the claims of any issued patents will provide sufficient protection from competitors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Because patent applications in the United States and certain other jurisdictions are maintained in secrecy for 18&nbsp;months or potentially even longer, and since publication of discoveries in the scientific or patent literature often lags behind actual discoveries, we cannot be certain of the priority of inventions covered by pending patent applications. Moreover, we may have to participate in interference proceedings or derivation proceedings declared by the United States Patent and Trademark Office to determine priority of invention.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Patents
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our patent portfolio includes issued and pending applications worldwide. These patent applications fall into four categories: (1)&nbsp;FAK inhibitor program; (2)&nbsp;PI3K/mTOR inhibitor program; (3)&nbsp;Wnt inhibitor program; and (4)&nbsp;other programs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	FAK inhibitor program
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are currently developing the following FAK inhibitors: VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 and VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;6063
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have exclusively licensed a portfolio of patent applications owned by Pfizer, which are directed to FAK inhibitor compounds and methods of their use, for example in cancer. One patent family is related generally to VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063. This patent family includes issued patents having claims covering VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 generically and specifically. For example, US 7,928,109 covers the composition of matter of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 specifically and US 8,247,411 covers the composition of matter of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 generically. Also included are issued and pending patent applications having claims directed to methods of treatment and methods of making VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063. For example, US 8,440,822 covers methods of making VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063. Any U.S. patents that have issued or will issue in this family will have a statutory expiration date in April of 2028. Related cases are pending worldwide, including for example in Europe, Brazil, Thailand, Hong Kong, and India, and granted in Australia, Mexico, Canada, China, Korea, Israel, New Zealand, South Africa, Singapore, Taiwan, and Japan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition to the issued and pending patent applications exclusively licensed from Pfizer, we own two patent families covering VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063. One family is directed to compositions (e.g.,&nbsp;oral dosage forms) of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 and certain methods of use. Any U.S. patents that will issue in this family will have a statutory expiration date in January of 2035. Another family is directed to methods of using a FAK inhibitor, such as VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063 in combination with a MEK inhibitor for treating a subject. Any U.S. patents that will issue in this family will have a statutory expiration date in February of 2035.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our licensed portfolio of patent applications from Pfizer also includes four families of patent applications directed to VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6062 and related methods of use. The patent families include issued and pending patent applications having claims directed to VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6062, methods of manufacture, and pharmaceutical salts. Patents have issued in these families in the U.S. that will expire in the December of 2023, April of 2025, and November of 2028, respectively. Related cases have been granted worldwide, including for example in Australia, Canada, China, Japan, and Europe.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;4718
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have exclusively licensed a family of patent applications owned by the Scripps Research Institute, which is directed to VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718 and related methods of use. For example, US 8,501,763 covers the composition of matter of VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718. The statutory expiration of any patent that has issued or will issue pertaining to VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718 has or will have a statutory expiration date in March of 2028. Related cases are pending worldwide, including for example in China and Canada. The patent has also been allowed in Japan and Europe.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
