<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	As discussed in Note&nbsp;10 to the consolidated financial statements appearing elsewhere in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;K, we are party to several agreements to license intellectual property. The license agreements require us to pay upfront license fees, ongoing annual license maintenance fees, and minimum royalty payments, totaling $155,000 per year beginning in 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, as well as reimburse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	certain patent costs incurred by the licensors, as applicable. We have not included maintenance fees in the table above since the minimum annual payments are perpetual and the agreements are cancelable by us at any time upon prior written notice to the licensor.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In July 2012, we entered into a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	l
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	icense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	greement with Pfizer&nbsp;Inc. (Pfizer) under which Pfizer granted us worldwide, exclusive rights to research, develop, manufacture and commercialize products containing certain of Pfizer&#x2019;s inhibitors of focal adhesion kinase (the Products), including VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;6063, for all therapeutic, diagnostic and prophylactic uses in humans. We have the right to grant sublicenses under the foregoing licensed rights, subject to certain restrictions. We are solely responsible, at our own expense, for the clinical development of the Products, which is to be conducted in accordance with an agreed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;upon development plan. We are also responsible for all manufacturing and commercialization activities at our own expense. Pfizer was required to provide us with an initial quantity of clinical supply of one of the Products for an agreed upon price. We made a one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;time cash payment to Pfizer in the amount of $1.5&nbsp;million and issued 192,012 shares of our common stock. Pfizer is also eligible to receive up to $2&nbsp;million in developmental milestones and up to an additional $125&nbsp;million based on the successful attainment of regulatory and commercial sales milestones. Pfizer is also eligible to receive high single to mid double digit royalties on future net sales of Products. Our royalty obligations with respect to each Product in each country begin on the date of first commercial sale of the Product in that country, and end on the later of 10&nbsp;years after the date of first commercial sale of the Product in that country or the date of expiration or abandonment of the last claim contained in any issued patent or patent application licensed by Pfizer to us that covers the Product in that country.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Under our drug discovery platform license agreement, which we amended and restated in January 2012, we also have agreed to make milestone payments to the Whitehead Institute upon achieving various development, regulatory and commercialization milestones. For each licensed product, we agreed to make milestone payments of up to an aggregate of $1,560,000 plus an additional amount for each subsequent approval of additional indications for a maximum number of licensed products. For each identified product that is not a licensed product, we agreed to make milestone payments of up to an aggregate of $815,000 plus an additional amount for each subsequent approval of additional indications for a maximum number of identified products. Each type of specified milestone payment is payable only for each of the maximum number of licensed products and the maximum number of identified products, as the case may be, to achieve the applicable milestone. In addition, a separate milestone payment is due upon the first commercial sale of each licensed product or identified product that is a diagnostic or prognostic test. A single additional milestone payment is due for the first issuance of licensed patent rights in the United States, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Spain or Italy. In addition, we have agreed to pay the Whitehead Institute
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	82
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage83"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	royalties as a percentage of net sales of licensed products. The royalty rate is in the low single digits as a percentage of net sales for licensed products that are therapeutics, the mid single digits for licensed products that are diagnostics or prognostics and less than one percent for identified products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Under our license agreement with Poniard that we entered into in November 2011 relating to VS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;4718 and certain other compounds, we paid an upfront license fee and agreed to pay Poniard milestone payments upon the achievement of specified development and regulatory milestones. In February 2014, we purchased the assets which were the subject of our license agreement with Poniard from Encarta,&nbsp;Inc. (Encarta), who had previously purchased those assets in 2013. In consideration for the assets, we issued 97,500 shares of common stock, a warrant to purchase 142,857 shares of common stock with an exercise price equal to $17.16 per share and paid $25,000. All existing obligations under the license agreement, including an achieved development milestone and an obligation to issue a warrant, were settled as part of this transaction. In connection with the asset purchase agreement, we also assumed the rights and obligations under the Scripps License Agreement. Pursuant to the Scripps License Agreement, we are obligated to pay Scripps potential product development milestone payments of up to an aggregate of $3,000,000 upon the achievement of specified development and regulatory milestones. In addition, we are obligated to pay Scripps low single
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209; digit royalties as a percentage of net sales of licensed products, subject to adjustments in certain circumstances. Our obligation to pay royalties on net sales is on a country by country basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Under our separate exclusive license agreement with the Whitehead Institute, or the cancer diagnostic license agreement, which we amended and restated in December 2011, we paid an upfront license fee and agreed to make milestone payments of up to an aggregate of $825,000 to the Whitehead Institute upon achieving specified regulatory and commercialization milestones. In addition, we have agreed to pay the Whitehead Institute royalties as a percentage of net sales of licensed products. The royalty rate is in the mid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;single digits as a percentage of net sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	OFF
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;BALANCE SHEET ARRANGEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We did not have during the periods presented, and we do not currently have, any off
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;balance sheet arrangements, as defined under Securities and Exchange Commission rules.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	TAX LOSS CARRYFORWARDS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of December 31, 2015, we had federal and state net operating loss carryforwards of $157.1&nbsp;million and $155.5&nbsp;million, respectively, which are available to reduce future taxable income. We also had federal and state tax credits of $3.2&nbsp;million and $1.4 million, respectively, which may be used to offset future tax liabilities. The net operating loss and tax credit carryforwards will expire at various dates through 2035. Net operating loss and tax credit carryforwards are subject to review and possible adjustment by the Internal Revenue Service and state tax authorities and may become subject to an annual limitation in the event of certain cumulative changes in the ownership interest of significant stockholders over a three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;year period in excess of 50%, as defined under Sections&nbsp;382 and 383 of the Internal Revenue Code, as well as similar state provisions. This could limit the amount of tax attributes that can be utilized annually to offset future taxable income or tax liabilities. The amount of the annual limitation is determined based on the value of our company immediately prior to the ownership change. Subsequent ownership changes may further affect the limitation in future years. At December 31, 2015, we recorded a 100% valuation allowance against our net operating loss and tax credit carryforwards of $72.6&nbsp;million, as we believe it is more likely than not that the tax benefits will not be fully realized. In the future, if we determine that a portion or all of the tax benefits associated with our tax carryforwards will be realized, net income would increase in the period of determination.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	RECENTLY ADOPTED ACCOUNTING STANDARDS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Deferred Taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In November 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	F
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	inancial Accounting Standards Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	issued A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ccounting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	tandards
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	U
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	pdate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2015-17,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	simplifies the presentation of deferred income taxes by eliminating the separate classification of deferred income tax assets and liabilities into current and noncurrent amounts in the consolidated balance sheet statement of financial position. The amendments in the update require that all deferred tax assets and liabilities be classified as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">

<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	noncurrent in the consolidated balance sheet. The amendments in this update are effective for annual periods beginning after December 15, 2017, and interim periods therein and may be applied either prospectively or retrospectively to all periods presented. Early adoption is permitted. We have early adopted this standard in the fourth quarter of 2015 on a prospective basis, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	it did not have an effect on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	financial position or results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
</EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item&nbsp;7A.&nbsp;&nbsp;Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
</FONT>
<A NAME="VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM7AQUANTITATIVEANDQUALITATIVEDISCLOSU">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are exposed to market risk related to changes in interest rates. We had cash, cash equivalents and investments of $110.3&nbsp;million and $92.7&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, consisting of cash, United States Treasury money market funds, United States Treasury securities, government
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;sponsored enterprise securities and corporate bonds and commercial paper of publicly traded companies. Our primary exposure to market risk is interest rate sensitivity, which is affected by changes in the general level of U.S. interest rates, particularly because most of our investments are interest bearing. Our available for sale securities are subject to interest rate risk and will fall in value if market interest rates increase. Due to the short
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;term duration most of our investment portfolio and the low risk profile of our investments, an immediate 100 basis point change in interest rates would not have a material effect on the fair market value of our portfolio.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We contract with CROs and contract manufacturers globally which may be denominated in foreign currencies. We may be subject to fluctuations in foreign currency rates in connection with these agreements. Transactions denominated in currencies other than the functional currency are recorded based on exchange rates at the time such transactions arise.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, $2.1&nbsp;million and 1.6 million of our total liabilities was denominated in currencies other than the functional currency, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<EFX_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

</FONT>

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item&nbsp;9A.&nbsp;&nbsp;Controls and Procedures
</FONT>
<A NAME="VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM9ACONTROLSANDPROCEDURES_391706">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our Chief Executive Officer and our Chief Financial Officer evaluated the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and procedures, as defined in Rules&nbsp;13a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;15(e) and 15d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, or the Exchange Act, as of the end of the period covered by this report. Based on that evaluation, our Chief Executive Officer and our Chief Financial Officer concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this report were effective.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Management&#x2019;s Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over our financial reporting. Internal control over financial reporting is defined in Rules&nbsp;13a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;15(f) and 15d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;15(f) under the Exchange Act as the process designed by, or under the supervision of, our Chief Executive Officer and our Chief Financial Officer, and effected by our board of directors, management and other personnel, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of our financial reporting and the preparation of our financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and includes those policies and procedures that:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:54PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:54PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of assets;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>

	provide reasonable assurance regarding the prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use or disposition of assets that could have a material effect on our financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Under the supervision and with the participation of our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and our Chief Financial Officer, we conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting based on the framework provided in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Internal Control&#x2014;Integrated Framework
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (2013 Framework). Based on this evaluation, our management concluded that our internal control over financial reporting was effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Changes in Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	There has been no change in our internal control over financial reporting occurred during the fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	quarter
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</FONT>
<A NAME="VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_REPORTOFINDEPENDENTREGISTEREDPUBLICACCOU">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Board of Directors and Stockholders of
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Verastem,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Verastem,&nbsp;Inc. as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, and the related consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive loss, stockholders&#x2019; equity and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. These financial statements are the responsibility of the Company&#x2019;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements and schedule based on our audits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. We were not engaged to perform an audit of the Company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting. Our audits included consideration of internal control over financial reporting as a basis for designing audit procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the Company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting. Accordingly, we express no such opinion. An audit also includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, and evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In our opinion, the financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of Verastem,&nbsp;Inc. as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, and the consolidated results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, in conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	/s/ Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Boston, Massachusetts
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	March&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

</FONT>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage95"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Verastem,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	1. Nature of business
</FONT>
<A NAME="VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_A1NATUREOFBUSINESS_390623">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Verastem, Inc. (the &#x201C;Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s a biopharmaceutical company focused on discovering and developing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	drugs to improve outcomes for patients with cancer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The Company&#x2019;s operations to date have been limited to organizing and staffing the Company, business planning, raising capital, acquiring and developing its technology, identifying potential product candidates and undertaking preclinical and clinical studies of its most advanced product candidates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company is subject to a number of risks similar to other life science companies, including, but not limited to, the need to obtain adequate additional funding, possible failure of preclinical testing or clinical trials, inability to obtain marketing approval of product candidates, competitors developing new technological innovations, market acceptance of the Company&#x2019;s products and protection of proprietary technology. If the Company does not successfully commercialize any of its product candidates, it will be unable to generate product revenue or achieve profitability. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the Company had an accumulated deficit of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$198.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million. The Company expects to continue to incur operating losses in future periods. The Company had cash, cash equivalents and investments of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	110.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million as of December 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company believes that its existing cash, cash equivalents and investments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	will be sufficient to fund its current operating plan and capital expenditure requirements for at least the next twelve months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2. Significant accounting policies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Basis of consolidation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Effective December 2012, Verastem Securities Company was incorporated as a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company and all financial information presented has been consolidated and includes the accounts of the Company and its wholly owned subsidiary. All intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated in consolidation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Use of estimates
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The preparation of the Company&#x2019;s financial statements in conformity with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the amounts reported in the financial statements and accompanying notes. On an ongoing basis, management evaluates its estimates, including estimates related to accruals and stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation expense. The Company bases its estimates on historical experience and other market
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;specific or other relevant assumptions that it believes to be reasonable. Actual results could differ from such estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Segment and geographic information
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Operating segments are defined as components of an enterprise about which separate discrete information is available for evaluation by the chief operating decision maker, or decision
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;making group, in deciding how to allocate resources and in assessing performance. The Company views its operations and manages its business in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	operating segment, which is the business of developing drugs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for the treatment of cancer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	All material long-lived assets of the Company reside in the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Cash and cash equivalents
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company considers all highly liquid investments with an original or remaining maturity of three months or less at the date of purchase to be cash equivalents. Cash equivalents consist of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	United States Treasury
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	money market funds,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	government
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;sponsored enterprise securities and corporate bonds and commercial paper
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of publicly traded companies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Cash equivalents are reported at fair value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Verastem,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Fair value of financial instruments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company is required to disclose information on all assets and liabilities reported at fair value that enables an assessment of the inputs used in determining the reported fair values. The fair value hierarchy prioritizes valuation inputs based on the observable nature of those inputs. The fair value hierarchy applies only to the valuation inputs used in determining the reported fair value of the investments and is not a measure of the investment credit quality. The hierarchy defines three levels of valuation inputs:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

	Inputs other than quoted prices included within Level&nbsp;1 that are observable for the asset or liability, either directly or indirectly

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Investments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Investments and cash equivalents consist of investments in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	United States Treasury
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	money market accounts,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	United States Treasury securities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, government
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;sponsored enterprise securities and corporate bonds and commercial paper of publicly traded companies that are classified as available
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;sale pursuant to Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 320,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investments&#x2014;Debt and Equity Securities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The Company classifies investments available to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Verastem,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	fund current operations as current assets on its consolidated balance sheets. Investments are classified as long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;term assets on the consolidated balance sheets if (i)&nbsp;the Company has the intent and ability to hold the investments for a period of at least one year and (ii)&nbsp;the contractual maturity date of the investments is greater than one year. Investments are carried at fair value with unrealized gains and losses included as a component of accumulated other comprehensive income (loss), which is a separate component of stockholders&#x2019; equity (deficit), until such gains and losses are realized. The fair value of these securities is based on quoted prices for identical or similar assets. If a decline in the fair value is considered other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;temporary, based on available evidence, the unrealized loss is transferred from other comprehensive loss to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	statement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and comprehensive loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;temporary declines in fair value of short
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;term or long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;term investments for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Realized gains and losses are determined using the specific identification method and are included in interest income in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	statement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and comprehensive loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	realized gains or losses recognized for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company reviews investments for other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;temporary impairment whenever the fair value of an investment is less than the amortized cost and evidence indicates that an investment&#x2019;s carrying amount is not recoverable within a reasonable period of time. To determine whether an impairment is other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;temporary, the Company considers the intent to sell, or whether it is more likely than not that the Company will be required to sell, the investment before recovery of the investment&#x2019;s amortized cost basis. Evidence considered in this assessment includes reasons for the impairment, compliance with the Company&#x2019;s investment policy, the severity and the duration of the impairment and changes in value subsequent to year end. As of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	investments with a fair value that was significantly lower than the amortized cost basis or any investments that had been in an unrealized loss position for a significant period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015,

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	cash, cash equivalents and investments included (in thousands):

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Concentrations of credit risk and off
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;balance sheet risk
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Cash and cash equivalents and investments are financial instruments that potentially subject the Company to concentrations of credit risk. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the Company&#x2019;s cash, cash equivalents and investments were deposited at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	financial institutions. The Company maintains its cash and cash equivalents and investments with high quality, accredited financial institutions and, accordingly, the Company believes it is not exposed to any significant credit risk on these funds. The Company has
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	significant off
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;balance sheet concentrations of credit risk, such as foreign currency exchange contracts, option contracts or other hedging arrangements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Property and equipment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Property and equipment consists of laboratory equipment, office furniture, computer equipment and leasehold improvements. Expenditures for repairs and maintenance are recorded to expense as incurred, whereas major betterments are capitalized as additions to property and equipment. Depreciation and amortization is calculated using the straight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;line method over the following estimated useful lives of the assets:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_21"></A>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Upon retirement or sale, the cost of the disposed asset and the related accumulated depreciation are removed from the accounts and any resulting gain or loss is recognized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company reviews its long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;lived assets for impairment whenever events or changes in business circumstances indicate that the carrying value of assets may not be recoverable. Recoverability is measured by comparison of the asset&#x2019;s book value to future net undiscounted cash flows that the assets are expected to generate. If such assets are considered to be impaired, the impairment to be recognized is measured by the amount by which the book value of the assets exceed their fair value, which is measured based on the projected discounted future net cash flows arising from the assets.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	material
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	impairment losses have been recorded through December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Research and development costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company expenses research and development costs to operations as incurred. Research and development expenses consist of costs associated with research activities, including drug discovery efforts and the development of product candidates. The Company accounts for nonrefundable advance payments for goods and services that will be used in future research and development activities as expenses when the service has been
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company expenses the fair value of employee stock options over the requisite service period, which is the vesting period. Compensation expense is measured using the fair value of the award at the grant date, net of estimated forfeitures, and is adjusted annually to reflect actual forfeitures. The grant date fair value of each stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based award is estimated using the Black
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Scholes option pricing model and is expensed on a straight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;line basis over the vesting period. Awards subject to performance based vesting requirements are expensed utilizing an accelerated attribution model if achievement of the performance criteria is determined to be probable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based awards issued to nonemployees, including directors for non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;board related services, are accounted for based on the fair value of such services received or of the equity instruments issued, whichever is more reliably measured. Stock option awards are revalued at each reporting date and upon vesting using the Black
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Scholes option pricing model and are expensed on a straight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;line basis over the vesting period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation awards which allow for greater than the minimum statutory tax withholdings are classified as liabilities. These awards are revalued at each reporting date and are expensed on a straight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;line basis over the vesting period. Upon settlement, the awards are revalued and the amounts are reclassified to additional paid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;in capital. Shares are withheld to cover the tax withholding and amounts paid to settle the tax liability are recorded as a reduction of additional paid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;in capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Income taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company accounts for income taxes under the asset and liability method. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and their respective tax bases using enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which the differences are expected to affect taxable income. Tax benefits are recognized when it is more likely than not that a tax position will be sustained during an audit. Deferred tax assets are reduced by a valuation allowance if current evidence indicates that it is considered more likely than not that these benefits will not be realized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Net loss per share
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Basic and diluted net loss per common share is calculated by dividing net loss applicable to common stockholders by the weighted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;average number of common shares outstanding during the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents. The Company&#x2019;s potentially dilutive shares, which include outstanding stock options, restricted stock units, unvested restricted stock and the warrant issued in 2014 are considered to be common stock equivalents and are only included in the calculation of diluted net loss per share when their effect is dilutive. All potentially dilutive securities were excluded from the calculation of diluted net loss per share as the securities were anti
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dilutive for all periods presented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	11
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">

	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage100"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Verastem,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.20%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Recent Accounting Pronouncements
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Leases
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In February 2016, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Financial Accounting Standards Board
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(FASB) issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Accounting Standards Update (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ASU) 2016-02,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Leases
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	(Topic 842)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The ASU requires lessees to put most leases on their balance sheets as a liability for the obligation to make lease payments and as a right-of-use asset, but recognize expenses on the income statements in a manner similar to today&#x2019;s accounting.&nbsp;&nbsp;The guidance also eliminates the current real estate-specific provisions for all entities.&nbsp;&nbsp;For calendar-year public entities, the guidance becomes effective in 2019 and interim periods within that year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Early adoption is permitted for all entities. The Company has not chosen early adoption for this ASU and is currently evaluating its effect on the Company&#x2019;s consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	November 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, the FASB issued ASU 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income Taxes: Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes (Topic 740)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ASU 2015-17 simplifies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the presentation of deferred income taxes by eliminating the separate classification of deferred income tax assets and liabilities into current and noncurrent amounts in the consolidated balance sheet statement of financial position. The amendments in the update require that all deferred tax assets and liabilities be classified as noncurrent in the consolidated balance sheet. The amendments in this update are effective for annual periods beginning after December 15, 2017, and interim periods therein and may be applied either prospectively or retrospectively to all periods presented. Early adoption is permitted.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	early adopted this standard in the fourth quarter of 2015 on a prospective basis, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	it did not have an effect on the Company&#x2019;s consolidated financial statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Going Concern
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In August 2014, the FASB issued ASU 2014-15,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Presentation of Financial Statements - Going Concern: Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(Subtopic 205-40). ASU 2014-15 requires management to assess an entity&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern every reporting period, and provide certain disclosures if management has substantial doubt about the entity&#x2019;s ability to operate as a going concern, or an express statement if not, by incorporating and expanding upon certain principles that are currently in U.S. auditing standards. ASU 2014-15 is effective for the annual period ending after December 15, 2016, and for annual periods and interim periods thereafter. Early application is permitted. The Company has evaluated the impact of the adoption of ASU 2014-15 on its 2015 consolidated financial statements and determined that there is not substantial doubt about the Company&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern for at least one year from the issuance of the 2015 consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;In May&nbsp;2014, the FASB issued ASU 2014-09,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ASU 2014-09
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	amends the guidance for accounting for revenue from contracts with customers. This ASU supersedes the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage101"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#VSTM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Verastem,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:11.7647058823529%;MARGIN-RIGHT:11.7647058823529%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	revenue recognition requirements in Accounting Standards Codification Topic 605, Revenue Recognition, and creates a new Topic 606, Revenue from Contracts with Customers. This guidance was originally pronounced to become effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016, with early adoption not permitted. On July 9, 2015, the FASB decided to defer the effective date of the ASU by one year. As a result, the Company will be required to apply the new revenue standard to annual reporting periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2017, and would be permitted to adopt the ASU early, but not before the original public organization effective date (annual periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016). Two adoption methods are permitted: retrospectively to all prior reporting periods presented, with certain practical expedients permitted; or retrospectively with the cumulative effect of initially adopting the ASU recognized at the date of initial application. The Company has not yet determined which adoption method it will utilize or the effect, if any, the adoption of this guidance will have on its consolidated financial statements as through December 31, 2015 the Company has yet to record revenue from its operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Each share of common stock is entitled to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	vote. The holders of the common stock are also entitled to receive dividends whenever funds are legally available and when declared by the board of directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	At-the-market equity offering program
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In December 2013, the Company established an at-the-market equity offering program pursuant to which it was able to offer and sell up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$35.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million of its common stock at then current market prices from time to time. In November 2014, the Company commenced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	sales under this program.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company sold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1,189,479
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,346,676
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock, respectively, under this program with net proceeds (after deducting commissions and other offering expenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$12.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$9.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Warrant
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In February 2014, in connection with the acquisition of intellectual property rights from Encarta, Inc., the Company issued a warrant to purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	142,857
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock exercisable at a price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$17.16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per share that expires
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years from the issuance date.
</FONT>
</P>

	Of the $

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	9.7
</FONT>

	&nbsp;million of stock-based compensation expense recorded during

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, $

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	10.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million was recorded to additional paid-in capital and approximately $4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was recorded as a decrease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in liability classified awards
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Of the $12.1&nbsp;million of stock-based compensation expense recorded during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, approximately $12.3&nbsp;million was recorded to additional paid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-in capital and approximately $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	248,000 was recorded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	decrease

	in liability classified awards

	. &nbsp;

	Of the $10.4&nbsp;million of stock-based compensation expense recorded during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, approximately $9.7&nbsp;million was recorded to additional paid-in capital and appro

	ximately $717,000 was recorded as

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	increase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in liability classified awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company has awards outstanding under
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	equity compensation plans, the 2012 I
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ncentive Plan (the &#x201C;2012 Plan&#x201D;) and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the 2010 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#x201C;2010 Plan&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, as well as the inducement award program
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Terms of stock award agreements, including vesting requirements, are determined by the board of directors, subject to the provisions of the individual plans. To date, most options gra
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	nted by the Company vest twenty-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	five percent (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	25
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	year from vesting start date and six and a quarter percent (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	6.25
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	%) for each successive
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-month period, thereafter (subject to acceleration of vesting in the event of certain change of control transactions) and are exercisable for a period of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	from the date of grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2012 Incentive Plan
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The 2012 Plan became effective immediately upon the closing of the Company&#x2019;s IPO in February 2012. Upon effectiveness of the 2012 Plan, the Company ceased making awards under the 2010 Plan. The 2012 Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	initially
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	allows the Company to grant awards for up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3,428,571
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	plus the number of shares of common stock available for grant under the 2010 Plan as of the effectiveness of the 2012 Plan (which was an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	30,101
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	plus that number of shares of common stock related to awards outstanding under the 2010 Plan which terminate by expiration, forfeiture, cancellation or otherwise. The 2012 Plan includes an &#x201C;evergreen provision&#x201D; that allows for an annual increase in the number of shares of common stock available for issuance under the 2012 Plan. The annual increase will be added on the first day of each year beginning in 2013 and each subsequent anniversary until the expiration of the 2012 Plan, equal to the lowest of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1,285,714
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of the number of shares of common stock outstanding and an amount determined by the board of directors. On January 1, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and January 1, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, the number of shares available for issuance under the 2012 Plan increased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1,081,045
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1,026,309
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	respectively
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for shares under this provision. Awards under the 2012 Plan may include the following award types: incentive stock options, nonqualified stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock awards, restricted stock units (RSUs), other stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based or cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based awards and any combination of the foregoing. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	under the 2012 Plan, the Company has granted stock options for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	6,331,493
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1,283,968
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	have been forfeited and restricted stock units for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	909,918
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	150,101
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	have been forfeited. The exercise price of each option has been equal to the closing price of a share of our common stock on the grant date.&nbsp;&nbsp;On January 1, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, the number of shares available for issuance under the 2012 Plan increased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1,285,714
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:11.95PT 0PT 12PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Inducement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;

	Award Program

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In December&nbsp;2014, the Company established an inducement award program (in accordance with NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Restricted Common Stock
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In connection with the Company&#x2019;s formation, the founders purchased an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2,857,138
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of Company&#x2019;s common stock at fair value on the date of issuance. The shares were issued subject to restricted stock agreements between the Company and each founder, which allow the Company, at its discretion, to repurchase unvested shares if the founder&#x2019;s relationship with the Company is terminated. Under these agreements, twenty
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	five percent (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	25
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	%) of the shares vested immedia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	tely and the remaining seventy-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	five percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(75%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of shares vest ratably in quarterly installments over the subsequent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	four
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company records stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation expense for the common stock subject to repurchase, or restricted common stock grants, based on the grant date fair value for employees and the reporting date and upon vesting fair value for non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;employees. The fair value of the award is considered the intrinsic value as of each measurement date. All of the restricted shares were issued at a purchase price equal to the fair value of the common stock on the date of issuance. The Company recorded stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation expense associated with restricted common stock grants of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$1.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$3.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>

	approximately

	$2.2
